snippet: A study asked a group of participants to reward fictitious players for their behavior after a touchdown. The results showed a significant difference in fouls called on black players.
abstract: Study published in Journal of Experimental Social Psychology tests racial bias in determining penalties for football players' unsportsmanlike behavior after scoring touchdowns; finds a tendency to penalize black players more severely, but it is unclear weather pattern holds true in NFL.
lead_paragraph: A study asked a group of participants to reward fictitious players for their behavior after a touchdown. The results showed a significant difference in fouls called on black players.

headline.seo: Experiment Examines Racial Bias in Penalties for Touchdown Celebrations
headline.main: Study Looks at Bias in Celebration Penalty Calls
